title: Calories in Meat Sauce Spaghetti
meta_description: Discover calories in meat sauce spaghetti per serving, including carbs, protein, fat, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Homemade bolognese-style: 140g cooked spaghetti, 120g meat sauce (ground beef, tomatoes, onions, herbs); ~260g total serving, no cheese or extra oil.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, portion size, meat type, pasta brand, and cooking method. Check labels or recipes for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One serving of spaghetti with meat sauce provides ~442 kcal and ~20 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use ground turkey instead of beef

faqs.q: How many calories in one serving of meat sauce spaghetti?
faqs.a: About 442 kcal for a standard 260g serving.

faqs.q: What are the macros in spaghetti with meat sauce?
faqs.a: Per serving: ~52 g carbs, 20.8 g protein, 13 g fat.

faqs.q: Does meat sauce spaghetti have a lot of sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 780 mg per serving due to sauce ingredients; varies by recipe.

faqs.q: How to reduce calories in meat sauce spaghetti?
faqs.a: Use leaner meat, less oil in sauce, or smaller pasta portions to cut ~50-100 kcal.

faqs.q: Is spaghetti with meat sauce high in protein?
faqs.a: Moderatelyâ€”~21 g per serving from beef and pasta.
